Here we go...it's up-cami. This time we have Rikako Sasaki of Angulum and
and Kisora Niinuma of Tsubaki Factory.
This program will take you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the upfront group.
We will show you our recording, rehearsal, and other production processes.
First of all, let's take a look behind the scenes of the two MCs. I, Sasaki, was recently invited to perform at JAPAN JAM,
We were the first to perform as the top batter,
On that day, we heard our fans' voices for the first time in about 3 years,
When we stand on stage like that, we all wear ear monitors,
Even though we were wearing earphones, your voices were still reaching our ears,
It had been a long time since we last performed on stage, so I felt that we all had a lot of energy,
I think we will be allowed to speak out at regular live performances from now on,
I am sure that you will be allowed to speak out at regular concerts in the future, but this JAPAN JAPAN performance made me very happy and moved me a lot.
I was very happy and moved by the performance of JAPAN JAPAN. That's how I feel.
That was it, wasn't it? The last FES you are going to perform?
Yes. The last. Maybe. Last? It might be, but it's the last?
I heard that it was a festival, and I heard from the staff that it was very exciting because of that.
I think the fans who were able to attend the festival must have had a very precious and enjoyable time.
And just like Rikako, I, Numa, am really looking forward to seeing you again.
I was really moved to hear the fans' voices for the first time in a long time at the Taiwan event.

And after that, during the spring tour, we had a live concert without cheering, but even without cheering, the excitement was different, and it was really fun. I wonder what will happen to the calls for the singles released after the Corona Disaster,
I'm curious. I'm excited about that too.
I'm excited about that too, so I'm looking forward to it,
I'm also looking forward to hearing the calls of the new members for the first time,
I'm really looking forward to that too.
I know that I have a lot to look forward to in the future.

It's time to say goodbye to Upcami, the group that Rikako Sasaki and Kisora Hayashi have been working on for the past few weeks!
We've seen a lot of videos this time, but I thought the BEYONDS instrumental recording was really cool, and I'd like to share it with you.
I love the instrumental recording section at every Upokami.
It's great, isn't it? I understand.

Upokami takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
Please subscribe to our channel as we will introduce you to parts of the artists that you normally don't get to see.
This time, upcami is joined by Rikako Sasaki of Angulum and
and Kisora Nounuma of Tsubaki Factory.
